definitions: someone who strokes or caresses animals or people affectionately
examples: The cat enjoyed being with the gentle petter
She was known as a frequent petter of dogs

definitions: woman's light loose undergarment worn under a dress or skirt
examples: She wore a white petticoat beneath her wedding dress
The vintage petticoat had delicate lace trim

definitions: act of stroking or caressing an animal gently
intimate physical contact between people involving caressing and kissing
examples: The petting zoo allowed children to touch the animals
Gentle petting helps calm nervous dogs
The teenagers engaged in heavy petting in the car
Petting was common at drive-in movie theaters

definitions: quality of being trivial unimportant or having little significance
examples: His petty complaints annoyed everyone at the meeting
She refused to engage in petty workplace gossip

definitions: popular garden plant with trumpet-shaped flowers in various bright colors
examples: Purple petunias filled the window boxes beautifully
She planted petunias along the garden border

definitions: long wooden bench with a back found in churches for congregation seating
examples: The family sat in their usual pew every Sunday
The old church pews were made of solid oak

definitions: gray alloy of tin with copper and antimony used for making utensils and ornaments
examples: The antique pewter tankard was worth thousands of dollars
She collected pewter plates from the colonial period

definitions: small spineless cactus containing mescaline used in Native American religious ceremonies
examples: Peyote has been used ceremonially for thousands of years
The peyote ritual lasted through the entire night

definitions: virus that infects and replicates within bacteria often destroying the host cell
examples: The phage therapy showed promise against antibiotic-resistant infections
Scientists studied how the phage attached to bacterial cells

definitions: ancient military formation of infantry with overlapping shields and spears
any bone of the fingers or toes in humans and vertebrates
examples: The Greek phalanx was nearly impenetrable in battle
Alexander's phalanx conquered most of the known world
The x-ray showed a fracture in the proximal phalanx
Each finger has three phalanx bones except the thumb

definitions: product of imagination or mental invention especially an unrealistic or bizarre one
examples: His phantasy novels featured dragons and magical realms
She lived in a phantasy world of her own creation

definitions: ghost or spirit of a dead person believed to appear to the living
something apparently sensed but having no physical reality
examples: The phantom appeared at midnight in the old castle
Local legends spoke of a phantom ship in the harbor
The patient experienced phantom pain in the amputated limb
The crisis turned out to be a phantom threat

definitions: pharmaceutical industry or business of developing manufacturing and selling medical drugs
examples: She worked in pharma for over twenty years
Big pharma companies invested billions in vaccine research

definitions: compound manufactured for use as a medicinal drug to treat or prevent disease
examples: The pharmaceutical underwent years of clinical testing before approval
Generic pharmaceuticals cost less than brand name versions

definitions: licensed healthcare professional who prepares and dispenses prescription medications to patients
examples: The pharmacist explained the medication's potential side effects carefully
She consulted with the pharmacist about drug interactions

definitions: scientist who studies drugs and their effects on living systems including development and testing
examples: The pharmacologist discovered a new compound for treating cancer
Clinical pharmacologists work closely with physicians on drug trials

definitions: branch of medicine concerned with drugs their properties effects and therapeutic uses in humans
examples: She earned her doctorate degree in pharmacology from Harvard
Modern pharmacology relies heavily on molecular biology research

definitions: store where medicinal drugs are prepared and sold to the public
science and practice of preparing and dispensing medicinal drugs
examples: The pharmacy stayed open late for emergency prescriptions
She picked up her medication at the corner pharmacy
He studied pharmacy at the university for four years
The hospital pharmacy prepared specialized IV medications

definitions: cavity behind the nose and mouth connecting them to the esophagus and larynx
examples: The doctor examined her pharynx with a small light
Inflammation of the pharynx causes a sore throat

definitions: large long-tailed game bird native to Asia often hunted for sport and food
examples: The pheasant strutted across the field displaying colorful plumage
They served roasted pheasant at the formal dinner

definitions: toxic white crystalline compound used in chemical synthesis and formerly as antiseptic
examples: Phenol was once used as a surgical antiseptic
The laboratory stored phenol in sealed containers

definitions: synthetic resin or plastic made from phenol used in electrical insulators and molded products
examples: The old radio had a phenolic case that lasted decades
Phenolic boards are used in high-temperature applications

definitions: philosophical movement studying structures of experience as experienced from first-person point of view
examples: His dissertation explored phenomenology in modern literature and art
Phenomenology influenced psychology sociology and architectural theory significantly

definitions: observable physical properties of an organism produced by genetics and environmental influences
examples: The plant's phenotype included purple flowers and tall stems
Identical twins can have different phenotypes despite sharing genes

definitions: chemical substance produced and released by animals affecting behavior of others of same species
examples: Ants use pheromones to mark trails to food sources
The moth released pheromones to attract potential mates

definitions: twenty-first letter of the Greek alphabet used in mathematics and science
examples: The golden ratio is often represented by phi
She wrote phi on the board to denote the angle

definitions: person who seeks to promote welfare of others through generous donation of money
examples: The philanthropist donated millions to build the new hospital
Local philanthropists funded scholarships for underprivileged students

definitions: practice of donating money goods or time to help others especially through organized charity
examples: Corporate philanthropy increased during the economic recovery period significantly
Her philanthropy focused on education and healthcare in developing nations

definitions: full-size symphony orchestra or musical organization devoted to orchestral music performance
examples: The philharmonic performed Beethoven's ninth symphony brilliantly last night
She played violin with the city philharmonic for decades

definitions: person who is hostile or indifferent to culture and the arts or has uncultured tastes
examples: The art critic dismissed him as a complete philistine
Her philistine relatives couldn't appreciate the modern sculpture

definitions: person who studies fundamental nature of knowledge reality and existence especially academically
examples: The philosopher spent years contemplating the meaning of existence
Ancient Greek philosophers laid foundations for Western thought

definitions: genus of flowering plants with clusters of colorful fragrant flowers popular in gardens
examples: Pink phlox bloomed along the garden path all summer
The butterflies were attracted to the fragrant phlox

definitions: extreme or irrational fear of something that poses little or no actual danger
examples: Her phobia of spiders made camping trips very difficult
Cognitive therapy helped him overcome his social phobia

definitions: small North American flycatcher with grayish-brown plumage that catches insects in flight
examples: The phoebe built its nest under the porch eaves
Eastern phoebes return to the same nesting sites annually

definitions: mythical bird that burns itself and rises renewed from its own ashes
capital and largest city of Arizona in the southwestern United States
examples: The phoenix became a symbol of rebirth and renewal
According to legend the phoenix lived for 500 years
Phoenix experiences extremely hot summers with temperatures over 110 degrees
The company relocated its headquarters to Phoenix last year

definitions: smallest unit of sound in a language that distinguishes one word from another
examples: English has about 44 phonemes depending on the dialect
Children learn to distinguish phonemes before they can read

definitions: person or thing that is not genuine or authentic but pretends to be
examples: Everyone could tell he was a complete phoney
The phoney designer handbag fooled no one

definitions: written symbol or character representing a vocal sound used in phonetic writing
examples: Chinese characters include both phonograms and ideograms
The ancient script used phonograms to represent syllables

definitions: device for playing recorded sound from grooved discs invented by Thomas Edison
examples: His antique phonograph still played old 78 rpm records
The phonograph revolutionized home entertainment in the 1900s

definitions: branch of linguistics dealing with systems of sounds in particular languages
examples: She studied the phonology of ancient languages extensively
English phonology differs significantly from Japanese phonology

definitions: person or thing that is not genuine or authentic but pretends to be
examples: The phony doctor was arrested for practicing without license
Her phony accent didn't fool anyone at the party

definitions: salt or ester of phosphoric acid essential for energy storage in living organisms
examples: Phosphate fertilizers help crops grow more efficiently
The lake suffered from phosphate pollution from nearby farms

definitions: substance that exhibits luminescence when exposed to radiation used in TV screens and lights
examples: The old television used phosphor coating on the screen
Different phosphors produce different colors under UV light

definitions: photographic reproduction of written printed or graphic material made by a photocopier machine
examples: Please make a photocopy of your driver's license
The photocopy was too dark to read clearly

definitions: profession of telling news stories through photographs often combined with written text
examples: Her photojournalism captured the reality of war zones powerfully
Digital cameras revolutionized photojournalism in the 21st century

definitions: journalist who tells news stories primarily through photographs rather than written words
examples: The photojournalist risked her life documenting the conflict
Award-winning photojournalists gathered for the annual press conference
